caption: My first there,  the food is good I was there for lunch special order shrimp in garlic sauce it was good , service is great and the staff is friendly I will return for dinner and drinks 👍

This has to be the best Chinese food in Brooklyn period! Food is always hot n fresh and quality is way above the local ones you find in neighborhoods! And although they say delivery times are usually between 35-40 minsi always get mine in about 20-25!!! Great place!! Go check it out!!!
The food taste horrible especially the pork chop Taste old and has a funny smell I won’t be buying there again

Excellent food. Very large menu and when you could eat in there the place is very beautiful and clean.also the waiters are wonderful. We ordered take out and all the food was packed so nice. I give this place a  10.
Cleanest and Same family for 30 yrs this is the ONLY place you can trust as far as Chinese food they take pride fast delivery and food consistently
The service was great and the food was delicious.   They have outdoor dining too.

One of the best Asian restaurants in Brooklyn and you would not believe how great the prices are here. Def a first place date or family dinner. Owner is great, he is always talking to the customers to makes use everything is good with all his customers.  You can't beat that. Highly recommend this place.
Great food excellent service. Precautions in place to ensure social distancing
Love the hospitality of the staff. Very peaceful place and food is delicious. They also have great lunch specials. I love their indoor dining.
Good food great service

Now just take out. Very nice and clean.  For some perfect place you can trust. Great for couples , sports events, bdays.  Youll see alot of neighborhood old timers that religiously go there.  Rare to see drinks and very good chineese. Open 3 decades. Family owned. Alcohol bar. Right off the train on famous 86st in brooklyn
Best mixed drinks. Really great soups and food selection. Definitely recommend. They do deliver as well.
Take out was fast and pleasant!

This place used to be really good 25 years ago, but now they cut back on some of the quality. The sweet & sour chicken is wrapped with breading filler to look like bigger chicken nuggets, while the chicken peices inside were actually small. (stringy almost ⁰tasteless dry chicken too, not juicy)  The roast pork fried rice used to have huge 1/2" square chunks of pork, now the pork size is the same as most other chinese take out, 1/4" square.  I was put on hold as soon as he answered & felt like he was rushing me afterwards. All business personality, almost cold, like I did something wrong. No hospitality over phone, sounded like he was either mad at something (ratings?) or just having a bad day, everyone knows if your serving the public you have to appear to be nice as it might affect your business.  Then, the delivery guy (maybe it was the guy who took the order!) took $20.00 tip instead of $10.00 like I told him out loud for him to hear but he took my three $20.00 bills & gave me $10.00 back. My order was only $29.00. Real Slick.  Now that I saw that past review about the huge roach, I wont be ordering from them anymore anyway.  The fortune cookies were stale too, they didnt snap open just bent slowly.  The positives: They still give pleanty of sauces & a fruit in the bag & yes that famous Pistatio ice cream with cherries is still awesome.
Almost always great food. I ordered on Friday, 9/3 each plate was disappointing. Wonton soup lacked flavor, other guests said food seemed old.
Old Time Restaurant - great food - clean and wonderful service.
Food incredible
Very good service the server was very kind and helpful. Made sure I was comfortable and she even let me use the bathroom during times like this I was super grateful.
I ordered home delivery during the pandemic. The whole family was well fed and happy. It was delicious. I don't think it's expensive.

I order two or three times from this restaurant in the past few months and was very disappointed in most of their dishes. I ordered chicken lo mein there was no vegetables inside I ordered fried rice it was just a fried rice with the beef that I ordered have no vegetables in the rice at all no egg no carrots peas onions scallions. I was very disappointed the way they just stir-fried the food and gave it to you without putting the components of the recipe inside the dish. The owner was very nice but the chef in the back is not doing a great job. I will give this place one more try before I decide not to eat there anymore. Thank you
It's nice there.
25$ for a large sesame chicken which is the worse ive ordered and an eggroll. Order elsewhere. Price gauge af.
Omg I was dying for Chinese food but everyone I know was closed so I found New Ruan on Postmates and omg their food was great. Freshest vegetables and the cpispy noodles are the best I have had...
Just placed my first order from this restaurant. The food came very  well prepared. It was hot and delicious.

Just ordered a delicious luncheon special consisting of shrimp and broccoli with pork fried rice. I have been living in the area for 5years and this is the first time ordering. Fast service, got my food hot in 20 Minutes. Thank you for your service in our uncertain times. Ruans NOW has a customer for life!
I don't like there Chicken soup because the Chicken is tough and rubbery has no flavor. I got sick on there food.
Friendly service, and food was delishhhh... I've had a great experience both times that I've been here.

Classic Chinese restaurant with standard Cantonese cooking.  Service was excellent.  Prices were consistent with the neighborhood.  It’s impossible to park there because there are multiple restaurants and stores on this commercial strip.  Food was okay although my portions of pork ribs was small.  Maybe it was a piglet?
It's ok

The neighborhood spot. The owners are awesome and caring of there customers.  My twin sister is a regular here and I come from time to time . The food is great here as well. Families have been coming here for years. A must try.
Foods delicious

Service was very good and so was the food. I had Beef with Eggplant and truly enjoyed the meal, which, like most entrees, is served with a choice of soup and white rice. The beef was incredibly tender and tasty and the eggplant was not mushy.  The pork with green beans was praised as were the other dishes eaten at our table. Hot and sour soup was tasty, slightly thicker than I like, but still very good. The steamed pork dumplings were perfect but, though tasty, the second order of dumplings were fried as opposed to pan seared. They have several reasonably priced  wines by the glass as well as a few beer choices, mostly standards. The restaurant itself is comfortable, the tables are comfortably spaced, and the place is not noisy. Definitely recommend this restaurant.
Very good!

Just ordered tonight. Wow what great Chinese food. Everything came packaged very nicely and food was very fresh! The boneless spare ribs could have used some sauce. But it was still good. Wonton soup, Lol mein and pork fried rice was amazing. Love that they give you a navel orange!
Good food and clean
The nastiest Chinese food I’ve ever tasted. I threw everything away. The food was extremely bland even the fortune cookie was stale. Try at your own risk !
This restaurant is great! The food is always good, the portions are big and the prices are great. The staff is friendly and welcoming.
Good food. I liked the fried rice and chicken broccoli. Definitely would eat here again.
Great
Love the customer service, pupu platters and their drinks. Yum!

Unsuspecting but tasty restaurant on 86th Street. I've driven by a million times without noticing it, but I'm glad I finally stopped in! It was pretty cheap for the amount of food that came out, and everyone at my table thorougly enjoyed their food. The "Shanghai Rice Cake Soup" was a very interesting combination of textures, and the "Chicken Three Flavor" is a very versatile dish that can absolutely be shared between two or even three people.
The best Chinese food I ever ate!
Excellent  service and the Food was great😉😉😉😊😊

The ribs are very fatty and under sauced, the stereotypical “no substation” law stands in this place the rice was dry and under seasoned the soup was decent, the chicken tasted weird and it took long to get here from 5 blocks away
Good spot and get the Lo mein
Best chinese food ever!
Convenient location

Everything was good the chicken and broccoli and all of the dishes I've ever gotten has been enjoyable service is attentive as long as the restaurant isn't full which isn't that often the prices are comparable to any other Chinese restaurant also this place serves old time Brooklyn Cantonese as well as some different style Chinese  food I highly recommend this establishment
Great food but the pricing of the food is not the same as it is on the website
Good food not a long wzit and good cocktails.
Food is awesome.
This food is absolutely disgusting
Horrible, waited a half hour for burned food.
Good food and staff.
I've had better.   Kind of dissappointed.
Its hot or miss there sometimes great other not so. Not constant.
Some of the best Chinese food around, hands down.
I'd say it's the best

Okay so... I liked Ruan's. Great people that work there. They are on point with delivery. They offer fruit with your deliveries etc. However, for the first time ever... I ordered a plain lomein and found a huge roach in it. There was no denying it was a roach, you clearly saw its antennas and retracted legs. Anyway, I called up the restaurant and told the guy to let him know as a courtesy thing and he hung up on me. I wasn't looking for money back or more food, just wanted to let him know... hey... check your kitchen there was extra protein in my meal. YUCK. Needless to say we threw away an entire $60 order.
Best Chinese in Brooklyn
Service is great but food is bland.
great food and service. it's a nice place to take the family for sit down service.
Traditional and American Chinese food of the highest quality. The prices are good too.
Not bad

Best Chinese food and it's also a real restaurant with real table cloth . Go and enjoy!

I would say the best chinese restaurant I ever ate in my entire life! Jimmy and Donald are the nicest owners u can ever conversate with. Fast service...waiters are very friendly!. U must try their steak! Yes their steak from the grill. Aged out of this world meat. I had their newest steak a couple weeks back..beleive it was $35. Oh my lord! Best steak I had in a very long time! Thank you so much for creating such an awsome experience. From a good customer Keith

Love this place ,great food good prices

I love how the restaurant looks like.😁😁
Always love coming here
I've been coming here for years great food experience is always pleasant and my family and I just love the tea
Excellent service and wonderful food.

Every time I come here whether it be lunch or dinner I leave so completely satisfied with the food I look forward to the next time I can come back. The service is amazing as well, real old-school vibe.
Service is good, food is delicious.
This place has good food and amazing service! The waiters are the best. They even comforted my crying baby

Very good food, friendly.
My fav Chinese food in New York. Salt and pepper shrimp is out of this world

This has been a family owned restaurant fo a very long time I knew the parents when they were alive and now the son runs it amazing men and the food is just as amazing. Last family restaurant in the neighborhood. You will love it.
Great foods!
An old-fashioned classic Chinese restaurant with good basic American style Chinese food

You haven't had real Chinise food untill you've eaten here, no need to travel to Chinatown when you have the best here in Brooklyn, I've eaten here numerous times and it never disappoints, great food, great service, great staff, great prices! Dont miss out on this Gem!

All food was delicious.The service  was excellent . . The waiter was cortious  and efficient We especially enjoyed the  masterful vegetable carviing of a Koi decorating the presentation of the steak Kew .
One of my favorite places!! Jim and Don are second to none!!
Not bad...
The food and the service is fantastic!
My friends and I were a little disappointed with the food. I remember it was better, years ago. The staff was friendly, at least. It wasn't the worst, but I won't be going back!

I knew the owner since I was a baby...good employees and amazing food and drinks! ♥ ☺
Nice staff great service
One of the best Chinese restaurants in bensonhurts, family oriented and food is amazingly delicious. Visit them,you'll won't be disappointed...

Always a great experience here. Staff is always nice and food is as fresh as you'll get in any Chinese restaurant. I only eat vegan foods ( well, when you eat out, you never know 100% if it's vegan or not, as I found out with Cici's recently 😩) and have to be creative. I asked them to make me sweet and sour mixed vegetables. The look on the waiter's face was priceless. Kind of like if you went into an Italian restaurant and asked for ketchup on pasta 🍝 😂 Not that I've done it, but Italians don't like you to experiment with their foods. What I like best about this place is their service. Keeping it real, Chinese food is Chinese food and only slightly differs, in my opinion. If you want a nice looking place that treats you well, here's the place for you. A little romantic also, if you're looking for that. 2 thumbs up!

Their Steak Kew is made with filet mignon. They have an unusual ice cream for dessert, pistachio with black cherries in it. There is nothing on their menu that should be missed.  Everything is perfect !
Very nice people, nice interior, good food
Good service,clean and excellent  food and specials

The food is tasty. The prices are reasonable. The service is friendly. They've been in the neighborhood forever. They even host school trips for the local public schools. They have a nice dinning area if you prefer to go out. They deliver as well. The service (for both dine in and take out) is quick. They take credit cards for dinning in but not for take out. It's a very traditional American Chinese restaurant like you remember from your childhood. The only complaint I have is just like the American Chinese restaurants from your childhood, they have the occasional cockroach climbing up the walls. Thankfully I never found one in my food. Although that's gross, I've seen many roaches in the best restaurants in this city as well, so I only deducted one star. Overall the restaurant is clean though.
usually good.  but sometimes the food is bland.  they may have different cooks on different days.
I used to love this place but my last visit the food was not great, maybe next time it will be better I hope.
The food was really delicious!
One of the best tasting Chinese places around Brooklyn - next best is jade garden on Staten island
The best Chinese food out there!!!
Excellent Service, excellent food, beautiful clean atmosphere. Well Maintained
Food was great
Excellent food, terrific service
Hands down the best Chinese food in 'hood. Their shrimp broccoli is quite something and delivery lightning fast!
Great place to meet friends with food and drinks.
Brooklyn"s best Chinese restaurant.
Great food!
Place is clean and food is delicious
American chines food. It's been there a very long time. Very good staff and the food is good.
The owner's are very nice, waiters are friendly and professional, good eats neighborhood staple.

Real old school Chinese place. Authentic Chinese American food with white glove service. Well mixed cocktails, fresh seafood, and well prepared steaks. The staff is attentive and have personalities. Great for a night out for two or a big family gathering. Call in advance for larger parties.

This is a wonderful establishment with great food and service.  Great for small (40 ppl) parties with well stocked bar.  Every dish is delicious and carefully prepared. My favorite is the Chicken and Broccoli, it is probably their number one selling dish.  They also offer take out.
The BESTEST in BROOKLYN
Terrible service. Bland food.

I've been coming here for over 20 years and the food remains as terrific now, as it was then. Best General Tso's chicken and double cooked pork, I've ever had. Actually, I've never had better Chinese food in general. Give this place a try. You won't be disappointed.
Service was great. Food was not worth the high price.
I had an excellent experience.  Their service is top notch, and their food is awesome as well.  I'll be back.
Good food and good service. Highly recommended.
The food was surprisingly good. The interior resembles a Chinese restaurant out in the land of suburbia.
Always excellent! Love them.
Great food
We love this place. It's been around forever and always has great food
price high
Food is always delicious and the service is always at its best.

My uncle and I come here frequently. Very good food. Afforable lunch specials. Jimmy and Donald are great guys. Attentive to customers.

Food is amazing. Authentic cuisine at a great price. All food is made in house and shows. Owners and staff friendly, funny and professional. Have been eating here for years.

Delicious Chinese food.
It's a high end Chinese take out and that means they serve high end beef Chow fun and beef and broccoli with petrol fried rice.
Is good

This place is a solid choice for me when in Brooklyn, for so many reasons. Food - GREAT! I've been here numerous times, and even had 2 birthday parties hosted here. Needless to say, I've had just about everything they have to offer. I've loved it all, every time. They essentially take Chinese appetizers, entrees, and even group platters, and then add an artistic presentation. Drinks - What can I say? They have it all. Anything I could think of getting, they have. They also have a FANTASTIC set of house drinks that can satisfy a diverse range of tastes. It's a small bar, so they don't carry EVERYTHING, and they don't have seating for more than 3 or so at the bar, but this isn't supposed to be a bar... So don't come here if you're looking for a watering hole that also serves good food. Service - Exceptional. I'm never there waiting for some attention, a refill, or a recommendation from the helpful staff. I'd say they're the biggest reason I come back. It would be hard for me to believe that anybody could have a bad experience here.
Best Chinese food I've ever had I'm not even exaggerating everything is fresh it's as if you got it from Manhattan
Great food great owner
food served cold. tasteless soup.use to be a good place to dibe. woykd not recommend
This is THE most old school Chinese restaurant in Brooklyn, now that Sun Shai Kai and Richard Yee's are closed.  Delicious food, perfect service and great value!
